rouse.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to wake someone who is sleeping deeply
rouse.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: A persistent ringing roused Christina from a pleasant dream.
rouse.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to make someone start doing something, especially when they have been too tired or unwilling to do it
rouse.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: She roused herself stiffly from her chair.
a campaign designed to rouse the younger generation to action
rouse somebody to something/to do something
rouse.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to make someone feel a particular emotion, such as anger or fear
rouse.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: We donâ€™t want to rouse any suspicions.
Paul strode forward, roused to anger.
